news.title: Superstar Rajinikanth Meets UP CM Yogi Adityanath, Touches His Feet as a Gesture of Respect | WATCH VIDEO
news.text: South Indian superstar, Rajinikanth, along with his wife, Latha Rajinikanth, made a visit to the city of Lucknow on Friday (August 19). This visit comes on the heels of the massive success of his film 'Jailer' at the box office, which has been creating waves since its release.Rajinikanth, who returned to the big screen after a two-year hiatus, has witnessed tremendous success with 'Jailer.' .Meeting with CM Yogi Adityanath Following a visit to the Badrinath shrine in Uttarakhand, Rajinikanth made his way directly to Lucknow. He began his visit by meeting Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya. During this time, a special screening of Rajinikanth's film 'Jailor' was organized. Both dignitaries sat down together at 1:30 PM to watch the film at Lucknow's INOX Megaplex within the Phoenix Pallasio. Following the screening, Rajinikanth proceeded to the residence of Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath.A video making rounds on social media captured the moment when Rajinikanth stepped out of his car and touched the feet of Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath as a mark of respect. .CM Yogi Adityanath warmly welcomed Rajinikanth with a bouquet of flowers and led him inside with utmost reverence.The two engaged in conversation, during which CM Yogi Adityanath presented Rajinikanth with a book and a shawl as tokens of appreciation..UP: Tuition Teacher Mohammad Aamir Held for Showing Inappropriate Videos to Minors | WATCH VIDEO
news.author: Since Independenc

news.title: Rajinikanth meets Jharkhand governor CP Radhakrishnan after trip to Himalayas
news.text: Superstar Rajinikanth is back from his Himalayas tour, and he has straightaway headed to meet Jharkhand governor CP Radhakrishnan in Ranchi. Radhakrishnan, hailing from Tamil Nadu, was the former state president of the Bharatiya Janata Party in the state. Pictures from the meeting of the two have been widely shared on social media. The governor also took to Twitter to share details about his meeting with Rajinikanth. He wrote, "On his arrival in Ranchi, delighted and very happy to meet my dear friend, one of India's greatest Actors and great Human Being Superstar Shri. @rajinikanth Ji at Raj Bhavan yesterday on a courtesy meet. I heartily welcome him to the great land of Jharkhand." On his arrival in Ranchi , delighted and very happy to meet my dear friend , one of India's greatest Actors and great Human Being Superstar Shri. @rajinikanth Ji at Raj Bhavan yesterday on a courtesy meet. I heartily welcome him to the great land of Jharkhand. pic.twitter.com/oyM049CWMv — CP Radhakrishnan (@CPRGuv) August 17, 2023 Rajinikanth gifted a spiritual book to the governor during the meeting. Back home, Rajinikanth's Jailer is breaking box office records one after the other. It has become the fastest Tamil film in history to cross Rs 150 crore at the box office. The movie has so far earned about Rs 450 crore worldwide. Rajinikanth left for his trip even before the release of the film. He will have a grand welcome once he is back in Chennai. Directed by Nelson Dilipkumar, Jailer is a masala film with cameos from Mohanlal, Shivarajkumar, and Jackie Shroff. With music by Anirudh Ravichander, the movie has become a hit in Telugu, Kannada, and Malayalam as well. Rajinikanth will next team up with TJ Gnanavel of Jai Bhim fame.
news.author: Nelson Dilipkumar

news.title: Rajinikanth Arrives In Lucknow To Meet UP CM Yogi Adityanath, Says I Will Watch Jailer With Him
news.text: Superstar Rajinikanth is all set to share the big screen experience of his latest blockbuster 'Jailer' with none other than Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. The Tamil icon, who has been ruling hearts for decades, touched down in Lucknow earlier today, heralding excitement among the city's cinephiles. With 'Jailer' already minting success at the box office, Rajinikanth's decision to personally view the movie alongside Yogi Adityanath comes as a pleasant surprise. As he disembarked from his plane, Rajinikanth shared, "I will watch the film with him," responding to queries about the eagerly anticipated movie screening. Gracing the film's triumph, Rajinikanth humbly attributed its success to divine blessings. "Sab Bhagwan ka dua hai," he expressed, his gratitude evident as he waved to the throng of fans eagerly awaiting his presence. RAJINIKANTH MET HER 'GURU' IN JHANRKHAND BEFORE ARRIVING IN LUCKNOW The superstar's recent journey to Ranchi, Jharkhand, where he paid homage to his 'guru' Yogananda, remains fresh in memory. Following 'Jailer's' triumphant release, Rajinikanth journeyed to the heartland to honor the teachings of his guru. During his solo journey, he shared moments with Jharkhand's governor CP Radhakrishnan, capturing the camaraderie through pictures shared on social media. ABOUT JAILER 'Jailer', an engaging Tamil film, marks Rajinikanth's return to the silver screen after a hiatus of two years. Released merely a week ago, the movie is a gripping tale of a jailer's valiant stand against a gang's audacious bid to liberate their incarcerated leader. With a global box office tally of approximately ₹375 crore in its maiden week, the film, featuring stalwarts like Tamannaah and Jackie Shroff, continues to enthrall audiences far and wide. news.title: Jailer box office collection Day 5: Rajinikanth film set to cross Rs 350-crore mark worldwide on Independence Day
news.text: Even in the midst of fierce competition from various quarters, Nelson Dilipkumar's Jailer, starring Superstar Rajinikanth in the lead role, is confidently pushing forward, firmly declaring its determination to maintain its impressive performance at the box office. Following its remarkable achievement of earning Rs 150 crore in the domestic market over its debut weekend, Jailer managed to generate an estimated Rs 28 crore on the fifth day of its release, which was Monday, according to early estimates shared by industry tracker Sacnilk. Thus, the global box office revenue of Jailer will cross the Rs 350-crore mark on Independence Day. The movie's net earnings in India on Monday surpass those from Friday (Rs 25.75 crore), indicating a stable advancement in the trajectory of Jailer. According to Sacnilk's forecast, the Rajinikanth movie is expected to achieve domestic earnings of around Rs 38 crore on Tuesday, benefiting from the Independence Day holiday, which will contribute to its ongoing impressive performance. The actioner also recorded an overall 63 per cent Tamil occupancy on Friday. While the film witnessed a 37.06 per cent occupancy in the Tamil market for morning shows, as the day progressed, the percentages steadily surged, reaching 59.03 per cent for afternoon shows, 72.84 per cent for evening shows, and an impressive 83.07 per cent for night shows. Meanwhile, industry tracker Ramesh Bala tweeted that Rajinikanth's Jailer made $180K in the US on August 14. As per analyst group Aakashavaani, the film garnered an estimated sum of Rs 33.45 crore from the US in its opening weekend. Concurrently, it accumulated around Rs 23.4 crore from the UAE region. Jailer also registered earnings of Rs 9.15 crore from the remaining Gulf Cooperation Council nations, Rs 3 crore from the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, Rs 5.55 crore from Australia, and Rs 68.2 lakh from New Zealand. The United Kingdom and Ireland together contributed Rs 7.68 crore, while Singapore provided Rs 6.78 crore. Furthermore, the film achieved Rs 17.01 crore from Malaysia, Rs 6.24 crore from Canada, and Rs 13 crore from Europe, Sri Lanka, and other territories. Currently, the only significant contender that matches Jailer's impressive box office success is Sunny Deol's Gadar 2, which has already secured Rs 173.88 crore at the domestic box office and is poised to achieve a Rs 55-crore turnover on Independence Day, contributing to its cumulative India nett earnings of Rs 228.88 crore. On Monday, Kamal Haasan also congratulated Rajinikanth and Nelson for Jailer's success. He called both of them and spoke about the film's performance and acceptance by the audience. Rajinikanth, meanwhile, is in the Himalayas and has not been a part of the film's success celebrations. The actor visited Badrinath on August 12 where he offered prayers. On August 14th, he was photographed at Dwarahat, Uttarakhand. According to figures shared by the Multiplex Association of India and the Producers Guild of India, the August 11-13 weekend has been the busiest weekend post-pandemic, with 2.10 crore admissions, which is also the highest combined admissions record in the last 10 years. Besides Jailer, Sunny Deol's Gadar 2 and Akshay Kumar's OMG 2 and Chiranjeevi's Bhola Shankar together earned Rs 390 crore in the period. Jailer has Rajinikanth essaying a man out to avenge the death of his cop son. The film has Mohanlal, Shivarajkumar and Jackie Shroff in important cameos. The action-packed entertainer also stars Priyanka Mohan, Tamannaah Bhatia, Ramya Krishnan, Yogi Babu, Vasanth Ravi and Vinayakan.

news.title: ‘My Love for Rajinikanth continues’: Japanese envoy Hiroshi Suzuki grooves to ‘Kaavaalaa’ song alongside YouTuber Mayo
news.text: It appears that Japanese Ambassador Hiroshi Suzuki’s fondness for Tamil superstar Rajnikant is only growing with time. On Wednesday, Suzuki shared a dance video alongside popular Japanese YouTuber Mayo, who is known for making videos about India and is fluent in Hindi. The duo danced to ‘Kaavaalaa’ number from Rajinikanth’s latest release Jailer. While sharing this clip, Suzuki wrote, “My Love for Rajinikanth continues …”. His video has over 12,000 likes so far. An X user wrote, “Ambassador of Japan to India wins Diplomat edition of #Kaavaalaa trend. Thank you @HiroSuzukiAmbJP for being such a great sport and embracing Indian culture.#Softpower. Thalaivar Rajinikanth's fandom has no boundaries ”. Echoing a similar sentiment, a person wrote, “Incredible to see you and Mayo san create magic through dance, blending #Kaavaalaa moves with Japanese flair. #Rajinikanth’s impact crosses oceans!”. Another person wrote, ‘Nicely done.These attempts are risky. Usually they end up cringe and offending the fans. But these folks have performed it elegantly and not making it look like they are mocking the video.” Previously, a day after Jailer’s release, the diplomat gave his best wishes to superstar Rajinikanth by sharing a video in which he is trying to learn Rajinikanth’s signature style of wearing sunglasses. Despite his best efforts, Suzuki fails to ace the trick but he nonetheless sends his wishes to the ‘Thalaivar’.
news.author: Trends Desk

news.title: Jailer box office collection Day 8: Rajinikanth film smoothly sails into second week, earns Rs 470 crore worldwide
news.text: Superstar Rajinikanth has once again proved that finding a worthy successor who can replicate his box-office dominance remains elusive. Even during weekdays, his latest film Jailer, directed by Nelson Dilipkumar, continues to maintain a consistent and impressive performance in theatres. On Thursday, which marked the eighth day of its release, Jailer recorded India nett collection of Rs 10 crore, according to early estimates shared by industry tracker Sacnilk. This effectively pushed the actioner's first-week earnings in the domestic market to an impressive Rs 235.65 crore. Among the various iterations of Jailer, the Tamil version has so far amassed Rs 186.05 crore, the Telugu version Rs 46.99 crore, and both the Kannada and Hindi adaptations Rs 1.9 crore each. Jailer worldwide box office As per trade analyst, Manobala VIjayabalan, the gross worldwide collections of the film currently stand at Rs 470.17 crore. #Jailer WW Box Office Racing towards ₹5⃣0⃣0⃣ cr club. Week 1 - ₹ 450.80 cr Week 2 Day 1 - ₹ 19.37 cr Total - ₹ 470.17 cr ||#Rajinikanth | #ShivarajKumar | #Mohanlal|| pic.twitter.com/QkKJsCUXfq — Manobala Vijayabalan (@ManobalaV) August 18, 2023 According to Sacnilk’s forecast, the Rajinikanth movie is expected to garner domestic nett earnings of around Rs 12.79 crore on Friday. On Thursday, the Tamil actioner achieved a cumulative 32.70 per cent Tamil occupancy. Initially, during the morning shows, the movie witnessed a 19.37 per cent occupancy within the Tamil market. However, as the day unfolded, the percentages experienced a consistent increase: rising to 28.50 per cent during the afternoon showings, reaching 40.37 per cent during the evening shows, and peaking at 42.54 per cent for the night screenings. Currently, the sole significant contender that equals the remarkable box office triumph of Jailer is Sunny Deol's Gadar 2, which is dominating the box office in the northern states. Jailer has Rajinikanth essaying a man out to avenge the death of his cop son. The film has Mohanlal, Shivarajkumar and Jackie Shroff in important cameos. The action-packed entertainer also stars Priyanka Mohan, Tamannaah Bhatia, Ramya Krishnan, Yogi Babu, Vasanth Ravi and Vinayakan. Pointing out that Rajinikanth and Nelson Dilipkumar rediscover the alchemy of a good masala film with Jailer, The Indian Express’ Kirubhakar Purushothaman wrote in his review of the film: “Jailer is Rajinikanth’s version of Kamal Haasan’s Vikram, but with a twist. Saying that doesn’t take away anything from this fun-filled entertainer.”
news.author: Nelson Dilipkumar

news.title: Watch: Rajinikanth Touches Yogi Adityanath's Feet At His Home In Lucknow
news.text: Actor Rajinikanth has met Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath at his residence in Lucknow. The actor arrived in the city on Friday night for the screening of his film 'Jailer', which was attended by UP Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya. In a video, Rajinikanth was seen touching Yogi Adityanath's feet at his home in Lucknow. Meanwhile, Rajinikanth expressed his excitement about the kind of positive response his film is getting from the audience and its success. "... It's God's blessing that the movie is becoming a hit," he told ANI. Earlier, Rajinikanth was in Ranchi, Jharkhand. He also visited the famous Chhinnamasta Temple in the state on Friday and offered prayers. He spent an hour meditating at 'Yagoda Ashram' in Ranchi. This was followed by his meeting with Jharkhand Governor C P Radhakrishnan at the Raj Bhavan. UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya praised the actor for his acting skills and said, "I also got a chance to watch a film titled 'Jailer'. I had watched Rajinikanth's many films and he is such a talented actor that even though there is not much content in the movie still he with his performance, he increases the importance of the film." 'Jailer,' which was released in theatres on August 10, has grabbed the box office by storm. In India, the film's eight-day total collection stood at Rs 235.65 crore (as of August 17). The film was released in several languages, including Tamil, Telugu, and Hindi. Rajinikanth plays a man seeking to avenge the death of his cop son in 'Jailer'. Mohanlal, Shivarajkumar, and Jackie Shroff are in important cameos.

news.title: Rajinikanth’s Jailer: All the box office records it has made and broken
news.text: Rajinikanth's Jailer has become one of the highest-grossing Tamil films in a matter of one week. While many such high-earning films take weeks to reach the spot, all it took for Rajinikanth-starrer was just a few days. Rajinikanth's fans initially were a bit sceptical about Nelson Dilipkumar directing their idol as the director had just turned out a damp squib, Vijay's Beast. However, the director has made a successful comeback with the film, which has earned Rs 450 crore worldwide in one week. The film has been breaking one box office record after the other ever since its release on August 10. Highest opening day collection for a Tamil film Before Jailer, Beast had the record of the highest opening day collection of Rs 35 crore, and Jailer beat it effortlessly by earning Rs 43 crore from across the world. While Beast and other big releases had early morning shows, Jailer didn't have such screening due to a new rule passed by the Tamil Nadu government. Fastest movie in the history of Tamil cinema to reach Rs 150-crore mark What's more impressive about Jailer is the pace at which the film is setting box office records! The film is now the fastest film in Tamil cinema history to cross Rs 150 crore in a matter of seven days. On day 7, the film earned Rs 159 crore, according to trade analysts. Previously, Ponniyin Selvan held the record by minting Rs 131 crore in a week. First Tamil film to touch Rs 400-crore mark in a week While it took four weeks for Kamal Haasan's Vikram to touch Rs 400-crore mark at the worldwide box office, Jailer pulled it off in a matter of a week. On day 7, the Rajinikanth-starrer crossed the milestone, earning Rs 411 crore, according to Sacnilk. Even Mani Ratnam's magnum opus Ponniyin Selvan managed to only mint Rs 324.05 crore in one week. Highest Tamil grosser of 2023 2023 already witnessed the release of big stars' films including Vijay and Ajith. In January, Thunivu and Varisu clashed at the box office with the latter emerging as the winner of the face-off. Varisu collected Rs 297.55 at the worldwide box office, while Thunivu managed to mint Rs 200 crore. However, Mani Ratnam's Ponniyin Selvan 2, which was released in April turned out to be the highest grosser by collecting Rs 345 crore (worldwide box office collection). Now, Jailer has broken all the records and has become the highest-grossing Tamil film of 2023. It has to be seen if Vijay's Leo, which will be released this year will end dethroning Jailer's record. Jailer records in other states According to trade analyst Ramesh Bala, the film is currently at the number two position in Kerala in terms of the highest box office collection for a Tamil film. "It is at all-time number two in Kerala, and it will soon take down Vikram and become all-time number one in the state. In Karnataka, also it will soon become the highest-grossing Tamil film. In Telugu as well, the film should be in the second or third position," he said. Jailer's international box office records When asked about the performance of the film in the overseas market, he said, "If you take the US, it is the all-time number two Tamil film. In the UK, it is behind only Ponniyin Selvan 1. In the Gulf region, like the UAE, it is now the highest-grossing Tamil film. Same case in Australie and New Zealand, where it is behind PS 1 and at the second position." Jailer's box office predictions The film is expected that the lifetime collection of the film will be around Rs 600 crore. "2.0 had a good run in Hindi. Also, it was released in Russia as well. So, it was able to collect around Rs 700 to Rs 800 crore. However, Jailer will beat Ponniyin Selvan 1 collection and become the second highest-grossing Tamil film of all time," Ramesh said.

news.title: ‘Jailer’ Crosses ₹350 Crore Worldwide In 5 Days, Expected To Soar On I-Day
news.text: Superstar Rajinikanth’s latest movie “Jailer” has been a massive hit at the box office, crossing a whopping ₹350 crore in just five days globally. This success comes after his previous film “Annaathe” didn’t fare as well. “Jailer” is not only setting the box office on fire but also reaffirming Rajinikanth’s superstar status. Released on August 10 worldwide, the film has received positive feedback from both critics and audiences. The movie is bringing people back to theaters, with its collection slightly dropping on Monday, August 14, which is common for weekdays. Still, it managed to earn around ₹28 crore net at the Indian box office, taking its five-day total to ₹178.60 crore in India alone. Trade analyst Ramesh Bala revealed on Twitter that “Jailer” had surpassed ₹350 crore on August 14. The film is performing exceptionally well not only in India but also in overseas markets. Directed by Nelson Dilipkumar, “Jailer” is a commercial action entertainer starring Rajinikanth as Tiger Muthuvel Pandian. The film features Vinayakan, Ramya Krishnan, and Vasanth Ravi in lead roles. Notably, Mohanlal, Shiva Rajkumar, and Jackie Shroff also appear in exciting cameo roles. Produced by Sun Pictures, the movie has music composed by Anirudh Ravichander. The technical crew includes cinematographer Vijay Kartik Kannan and editor R Nirmal. ALSO READ: ‘Gadar 2’ Declared As A BlockBuster After Collecting ₹135 Crore The film’s success is anticipated to continue, with expectations that it will cross the ₹350 crore mark soon, especially with the Independence Day holiday boosting collections.The movie has gained huge positive reviews, marking Rajinikanth’s strong comeback to the big screen. It’s worth noting that “Jailer” has performed exceptionally well in foreign countries too, earning over ₹105 crore outside India.
news.author: Cinemedia Reporter

news.title: Jailer box office collection Day 6: Rajinikanth film eyes Rs 400-crore mark, among five biggest Tamil hits ever
news.text: Superstar Rajinikanth's latest release, Jailer, has swiftly proven his box office dominance by surpassing the Rs 200 crore mark in India within six days of its release. The movie's success is projected to propel it towards the Rs 400 crore mark globally. Only four films have previously gone past Rs 400 crore mark in the history of Tamil cinema - Rajinikanth's 2.O and Kabali, Ponniyin Selvan and Vikram. The film is expected to enter this hallowed club today. As per early estimates from industry tracker Sacnilk, Jailer, featuring Rajinikanth, earned around Rs 33 crore in India on Independence Day (August 15), boosting its net domestic earnings to Rs 207.15 crore. The film is recording the highest occupancy rate of 81.59 percent in Tamil Nadu. Considering its box office performance, Jailer is poised to outshine Mani Ratnam's Ponniyin Selvan: Part 1 collections in Tamil Nadu. This achievement would make Jailer the highest-grossing film in the state. Industry tracker Ramesh Bala echoed this sentiment, stating, "#Jailer will beat #PS1 to become the Highest Grossing Movie in TN!" #Jailer will beat #PS1 to become the Highest Grossing Movie in TN! — Ramesh Bala (@rameshlaus) August 15, 2023 In the Southern region, Jailer has been maintaining its momentum with minimal competition, as Chiranjeevi's recent release, Bhola Shankar, struggles at box office. In the Northern market, however, Jailer faces rivalry from Sunny Deol's Gadar 2, which has amassed Rs 229 crore in India since its release on August 11. Jailer, an action-packed entertainer, hit theatres on August 10. The film features explosive cameos from Shiva Rajkumar, Mohanlal and Bollywood actor Jackie Shroff. Its favourable reviews have undoubtedly contributed to its immense success. Kirubhakar Purushothaman of indianexpress.com gave the film 3.5 stars and wrote, "Of course, Jailer’s story is similar to Kamal Haasan’s Vikram in a lot of ways, but this one is not too gloomy as Lokesh Kanagaraj’s film. Nelson’s film doesn’t hesitate to make fun of some of the most delicate situations, because all that matters to the director is to keep you entertained."

news.text: Rajinikanth-starrer Jailer, which was released on August 10, crossed the Rs 200 crore mark (domestic) on Independence Day, and on its seventh day in theatres, the film has managed to bring in Rs 15 crore across India, as per industry tracker Sacnilk. The Nelson Dilipkumar film, also starring Ramya Krishnan, Vinayakan, Yogi Babu and Mohanlal, released with a UA certificate and received a 3.5 star rating from indianexpress.com's Kirubhakar Purushothaman, who called it a "good masala film." The movie, which also stars Tamannaah and Jackie Shroff, has earned around Rs 375 crore worldwide in the first week, according to Sun Pictures.

news.title: Jailer box office day 9: Rajinikanth starrer to cross Rs 500 crore mark worldwide today
news.text: Actor Rajinikanth's action entertainer Jailer has been attracting audiences for over a week now, and the ninth day was no different. As per trade website Sacnilk, Jailer made Rs 9 crore on its ninth day, with Tamil occupancy leading at 34.53 percent. The film's total India net collections stands at Rs 244.85 crore. Jailer managed to get Rs 235.85 crore in its first week, with Tamil audience bringing in Rs 184.65 crore, Telugu with Rs 47.05 crore, Kannada Rs 2.05 crore and Hindi adding Rs 2.1 crore to the first week's collection. The film's night shows in Tamil are of utmost importance as they are bringing in the maximum number, 54.59 percent occupancy. Jailer worldwide box office As per trade analyst Manobala Vijaybalan, the film is expected to touch Rs 500 cross globally on Saturday. He tweeted, "#Jailer WW Box Office Week 1 - Rs 450.80 cr Week 2 Day 1 - Rs 19.37 cr Day 2 - Rs 17.22 cr Total - Rs 487.39 cr". #Jailer WW Box Office Week 1 - ₹ 450.80 cr Week 2 Day 1 - ₹ 19.37 cr Day 2 - ₹ 17.22 cr Total - ₹ 487.39 cr All set to BREACH ₹5⃣0⃣0⃣ cr today. ||#Rajinikanth | #ShivarajKumar | #Mohanlal|| pic.twitter.com/0bFt5bAktr — Manobala Vijayabalan (@ManobalaV) August 19, 2023 Jailer continues to put up a strong fight against other releases across India like Gadar 2 and OMG 2. Chiranjeevi's Telugu offering Bholaa Shankar, which released a day after Jailer was expected to bring in some competition but Rajinikanth's film emerged as the clear winner. The Nelson Dilipkumar directorial also stars Tamannaah Bhatia in a pivotal role and tells the story of a man, who is out to avenge his cop son's death. The film also stars Mohanlal, Jackie Shroff and Shivarajkumar in significant roles. Besides them, the movie also features Priyanka Mohan, Ramya Krishnan, Yogi Babu, Vasanth Ravi and Vinayakan.

news.title: An Akhilesh Yadav-Rajinikanth Hug After Actor Touched Yogi Adityanath Feet
news.text: A day after superstar Rajinikanth was seen touching Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's feet at his home in Lucknow, Samajwadi Party boss Akhilesh Yadav today tweeted a picture of him hugging the south Indian megastar. In what is being seen as a swipe at the saffron-clad Chief Minister, he posted a "when hearts meet" message along with the picture. "People hug when hearts meet," he wrote, adding that he feels as happy meeting the superstar now as he did when he saw him on screen while studying engineering in Mysuru. "We met in a personal capacity nine years ago, and have been friends since," he added. जब दिल मिलते हैं तो लोग गले मिलते हैं।मैसूर में इंजीनियरिंग की पढ़ाई के दौरान पर्दे पर रजनीकांत जी को देखकर जितनी ख़ुशी होती थी वो आज भी बरकरार है। हम 9 साल पहले व्यक्तिगत रूप से मिले और तब से दोस्ती है… pic.twitter.com/e9KZrc5mNH— Akhilesh Yadav (@yadavakhilesh) August 20, 2023 He posted another picture of them sharing a laugh, sitting side by side at his residence. — Akhilesh Yadav (@yadavakhilesh) August 20, 2023 Rajinikanth met Yogi Adityanath at his residence in Lucknow on Saturday. The actor arrived in the city on Friday night for the screening of his film 'Jailer', which was attended by UP Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya. UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya praised the actor for his acting skills and said, "I also got a chance to watch a film titled 'Jailer'. I have seen many of Rajinikanth's films, and he is such a talented actor that even though there is not much content in the film, still, with his performance, he elevates it." 'Jailer,' which released in theatres on August 10, is a box office hit. In India, the film's eight-day total collection stood at Rs 235.65 crore (as of August 17). The film was released in several languages, including Tamil, Telugu, and Hindi.

news.title: A bow for Yogi Adityanath, and a hug for Akhilesh Yadav; Ayodhya next: Rajinikanth on UP tour
news.text: Tamil superstar Rajinikanth, who is touring Uttar Pradesh to promote his film 'Jailer', met with Samajwadi Party leader Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday, a day after his 'courtesy meeting' with UP CM Yogi Adityanath. "During my engineering studies in Mysore, the happiness I felt seeing Rajinikanth ji on the screen is still intact. We met in person 9 years back and have been friends ever since," Yadav wrote in a post on X (formerly Twitter) after the meeting at his residence in Lucknow. जब दिल मिलते हैं तो लोग गले मिलते हैं। मैसूर में इंजीनियरिंग की पढ़ाई के दौरान पर्दे पर रजनीकांत जी को देखकर जितनी ख़ुशी होती थी वो आज भी बरकरार है। हम 9 साल पहले व्यक्तिगत रूप से मिले और तब से दोस्ती है… pic.twitter.com/e9KZrc5mNH — Akhilesh Yadav (@yadavakhilesh) August 20, 2023 Meanwhile, Rajinikanth told reporters, “Nine years ago, I had met Akhilesh at a function in Mumbai. Since then, our friendship has continued, and we talk over the phone. I had come here five years ago for a shooting, (but) Akhilesh was not there, and (I) could not meet him. He is here now and I met him." On Saturday, the renowned actor met Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath at his residence in Lucknow. He was photographed touching the CM's feet. The veteran actor is also scheduled to visit Ayodhya on Sunday.
news.author: Express Web Desk

news.title: Gadar 2 box office collection day 4: Sunny Deol film records biggest Monday collections of all time, nets a total of Rs 173 cr
news.text: Actor Sunny Deol's latest film Gadar 2 box office collection on Monday showed no signs of slowing down as it recorded mammoth numbers on its fourth day. After a weekend collection of Rs 134 cr, Gadar 2 continued its momentum and netted an estimated Rs 39 cr on Monday, industry tracker Sacnilk reported. With a huge Monday, Gadar's total box office collections are now Rs 173 cr- a figure which has surpassed expectations of many in the trade, who expected Gadar 2 to fire but certainly not with this intensity. Box Office India reported that the collections of the film on Monday will be an "all-time record" as even on holidays big films struggle to get 30 crore net. The four-day collections have now set the film for a massive Tuesday number on account of Independence Day. Gadar 2 is eyeing to clock at least Rs 55 cr on August 15, which would take its total to Rs 230 cr in five days, Sacnilk reported. Gadar 2 will manage these numbers despite a clash with Akshay Kumar fronted OMG2, which dented its showcasing. Gadar 2 will now challenge the lifetime total of Shah Rukh Khan’s Pathaan, which remains as the biggest Bollywood hit with collections of Rs 524 crore (Hindi) nett. Bollywood trade analyst Taran Adarsh is confident Gadar 2 will enter the Rs 200 crore club within the first week with a sizable ticket sales set to take place on the Independence Day. He had earlier tweeted, “It's crystal clear by now - if #Gadar2 was a solo release, NOT clashing with another #Hindi film - it would've easily added another ₹ 30 cr in its *weekend total*." TARA SINGH SMASHES THE #BO WITH HIS SLEDGE HAMMER… #Gadar2 creates #Gadar at the #BO… The GLORIOUS opening weekend proves, yet again, that *well-made* desi entertainers will never go out of fashion… All eyes on #IndependenceDay: Picture abhi baaki hain… Fri 40.10 cr, Sat… pic.twitter.com/hfDmrv0rPo — taran adarsh (@taran_adarsh) August 14, 2023 International magazine Deadline also mentioned the film's box office success and said international entertainers should be promoted as Hollywood reels from the impact of the ongoing SAG-AFTRA strike. The magazine named Gadar 2 and Rajinikanth's Jailer as good choices. The sequel to Gadar Ek Prem Katha, which emerged as a blockbuster in 2001, is set in 1971, amidst the backdrop of the partition of Bangladesh and East Pakistan. Directed by Anil Sharma, it also stars Ameesha Patel and Utkarsh Sharma in important roles. Gadar 2 has emerged as Sunny Deol's biggest hit in his 40-year career. It is also his first film to enter the Rs 100 crore club. In fact, seeing the unprecedented demand for the film, early morning and late-night shows were added in many parts of North India by exhibitors. Along with Rajinikanth's Jailer, Akshay's OMG 2, Chiranjeevi's Bhola Shankar, Gadar 2 contributed more than Rs 390 crore to the combined gross box office in theatres across India, the highest in the last 100 years. According to a joint statement by the Multiplex Association of India (MAI) and Producers Guild of India, over 2.10 crore moviegoers thronged the theatres, the highest number of admissions in the last decade.
news.author: Anil Sharma

news.title: Kannada star Shivarajkumar elated as his performance in Jailer gets massive reception; Rajinikanth’s videos from Himalayan voyage go viral
news.text: Having swiftly surpassed the Rs 200-crore milestone in the domestic market within a mere six days, Nelson Dilipkumar’s Jailer, featuring superstar Rajinikanth in the lead role, is now poised to hit the Rs 400-crore mark at the global box office, positioning itself as one of the biggest releases of the year. While Rajinikanth's fans continue their exuberant celebrations of the movie, admirers of Kannada superstar Shivarajkumar are equally elated, stirred by the actor's impactful cameo appearance in the film, which resonated profoundly nationwide owing to its mass appeal. Despite his character being depicted in only two scenes, Shivarajkumar's portrayal of Narasimha instantly captured hearts, a testament to the actor's remarkable ability to seamlessly inhabit his roles. Opening up about his initial apprehension regarding the audience's reception of his performance, Shivarajkumar, fondly known as Shivanna among his fans, told Cinema Express that the feedback he received was both heartwarming and humbling. "Since the movie's release, I've experienced a range of emotions. I was anxious about how my performance would be perceived. The audience's perspective remains a mysterious and unpredictable element." "The way people have perceived me since the release of Jailer has been different. it is heartwarming and humbling. I'm thankful for the affection shown for my appearance in Jailer, and I give a significant portion of the credit to director Nelson and, most importantly, the legendary Rajinikanth." When questioned about his experience collaborating with stars from various industries in Jailer, Shivanna remarked, "Working with Rajinikanth has truly been a unique experience for me. I have had the chance to meet him in more casual settings, and there exists a special bond that traces back to my younger days." "When it comes to Ramya Krishnan, we have previously collaborated on a Kannada film. She exudes brilliance and versatility as an actor, boasting remarkable talent. I haven't had the opportunity to share screen space with Mohanlal, and even in Jailer, we didn't have scenes together. But I am absolutely enthusiastic about the prospect of collaborating with him in the future," he added. Shivarajkumar also pointed out that his favourite moments in Jailer are the scenes where Rajinikanth is depicted at home, interacting with the family and cherishing tender moments with his grandchild. "This scene exemplifies Rajinikanth's unique ability to transcend his superstar persona and portray a genuine, relatable human on screen," he said. Superstar Rajinikanth's pictures from Uttarakhand go viral While the entire Team Jailer and his fervent fans rejoice in the remarkable triumph of the film, superstar Rajinikanth has distanced himself from the commotion, indulging in a period of spiritual seclusion in the Himalayas. இன்று மகாவதார் பாபாஜி குகைக்கு இரண்டு மணி நேரத்திற்கு மேல் மலையேறி நம் அன்புத் தலைவர் @rajinikanth அவர்கள் தியானம் செய்தார்! 49 ஆண்டுகளுக்கு முன் இந்த ஆகஸ்ட் 15ஆம் நாள் அவரது முதல் திரைப்படம் அபூர்வ ராகம் வெளியானது குறிப்பிடத்தக்கது. pic.twitter.com/Bfg4tR7SD8 — Ra.Arjunamurthy | ரா.அர்ஜூனமூர்த்தி (@RaArjunamurthy) August 15, 2023 யோகதா சத்சங்க ஆசிரமம் - துவாரஹதில் நம் அன்புத் தலைவர் @rajinikanth அவர்கள். pic.twitter.com/OYTACBYsCM — Ra.Arjunamurthy | ரா.அர்ஜூனமூர்த்தி (@RaArjunamurthy) August 14, 2023 இடம்: யோகதா சத்சங்க ஆசிரமம் - துவாரஹத் இன்று நம் அன்புத் தலைவர் @rajinikanth அவர்கள் யோகதா சத்சங்க ஆசிரமம் - துவாரஹாத்தில், ஸ்வாமிஜிகளுடன் இணைந்து இந்திய சுதந்திர தினத்தை முன்னிட்டு மூவர்ணக் கொடி ஏந்தி கொண்டாடினார்… pic.twitter.com/P5E7qMBKq4 — Ra.Arjunamurthy | ரா.அர்ஜூனமூர்த்தி (@RaArjunamurthy) August 14, 2023 சிரஞ்சீவி வியாசர் அவதரித்த “ஆடி”மாதத்தில் அவரின் இருப்பிடத்திற்கே சென்று அன்பு தலைவர் @rajinikanth அவர்கள் வணங்கியது ஆனந்தம்! pic.twitter.com/4pkfyN6hBS — Ra.Arjunamurthy | ரா.அர்ஜூனமூர்த்தி (@RaArjunamurthy) August 13, 2023 வியாசர் குகைக்கு அன்புத் தலைவர் @rajinikanth அவர்களின் வருகை! அத்தனை உயரத்தில் இருக்கும் மலையிலும் அவரின் பெருமை! pic.twitter.com/jCr6Cr8unV — Ra.Arjunamurthy | ரா.அர்ஜூனமூர்த்தி (@RaArjunamurthy) August 13, 2023 இந்த இளைஞர் சென்னையில் இருந்து மகாவதார் பாபாஜி குகைக்கு 55 நாட்கள் நடந்து சென்று நம் அன்புத் தலைவர் @rajinikanth அவர்களை சந்தித்தார். தலைவர் அவருக்கு பண உதவி செய்தார். மேலும் குளிர்ந்த காலநிலையில் ஒரு மரத்தடியில் தூங்கிக் கொண்டிருந்த அவரை இப்போது ஒரு சன்யாசியுடன் ஒரு சிறிய… pic.twitter.com/J5dR6gfm24 — Ra.Arjunamurthy | ரா.அர்ஜூனமூர்த்தி (@RaArjunamurthy) August 15, 2023 Rajini's associate Ra Arjunamurthy has been consistently sharing images and videos of the actor via his social media account. According to the updates, the Jailer actor visited Vyas Cave in the Chamoli district of Uttarakhand, commemorated Independence Day at Yogoda Satsanga Sakha Ashram in Dwarahat, and engaged in meditation at the cave of Mahavatar Babaji. Rajini also encountered a young man who embarked on a nearly 55-day journey from Chennai to Uttarakhand to meet him. In addition to offering financial assistance, the superstar also aided the young man in finding suitable accommodation, as he had been sleeping under a tree in the chilly weather. Jailer has Rajinikanth essaying a man out to avenge the death of his cop son. The film has Mohanlal, Shivarajkumar and Jackie Shroff in important cameos. The action-packed entertainer also stars Priyanka Mohan, Tamannaah Bhatia, Ramya Krishnan, Yogi Babu, Vasanth Ravi and Vinayakan.

news.title: Japan Ambassador Hiroshi Suzuki expresses his love for Rajinikanth's 'Jailer', hop on 'Kaavaalaa' song
news.text: Mumbai (Maharashtra) [India], August 17 (ANI): The'Jailer' song 'Kaavaalaa' featuring Tamannaah Bhatia and Rajinikanth has become very popular. After the video of a Japanese man dancing to the song went viral, now Hiroshi Suzuki, Ambassador of Japan to India created a video with Japanese YouTuber Mayo San in which he is seen shaking his legs on the track. Taking to X (formerly Twitter), he wrote in the caption,"Kaavaalaa dance video with Japanese YouTuber Mayo san(@MayoLoveIndia) My Love for Rajinikanth continues ... @Rajinikanth Jailer rajinifans..Video courtesy: Japanese Youtuber Mayo san and her team"Videos of many social media users dancing to this popular song have been posted online. Earlier also Suzuki posted a video in which he was seen flipping his glasses like Rajnikanth. He was seen taking the help of another person to do it in the right way. He wrote along with the video, Vannakkam!@Rajinikanth, Japan also loves you a lot!Jailer rajinifans"Sung by Shilpa Rao and Anirudh Ravichander, the lyrics were penned by Arunraja Kamaraj. The dance moves of Tamannaah and Rajinikanth and the beats of the song from'Jailer' made it viral and trending. During the song launch, Tamannaah spoke about the song's success. She told ANI,"People have given so much love. The song is trending so much that normally we promote films but now this song has promoted us so much that we literally have to come out and talk about the love that people have given us and made it a trend. Jailer of course is a film that has been dubbed in Hindi,Malayalam, Kannada, Tamil, and Telugu. So, it will; definitely reach out to. It's rooted Tamil film which hopefully will reach out to all the audience."Helmed by Nelson Dilipkumar, Rajinikanth plays the role of Jailer Muthuvel Pandian. The film is touted to be an action-packed entertainer and has a stellar star cast that includes Priyanka Mohan, Shiva Rajkumar, Jackie Shroff, Ramya Krishnan, Yogi Babu, Vasanth Ravi, Vinayakan in prominent roles. (ANI)
news.author: Shilpa Rao

news.title: "Wanted to show our love for Rajini", Japenese YouTuber Mayo shares her experience of shaking a leg to Rajni's 'Kaavaalaa'
news.text: New Delhi [India], August 17 (ANI): Mayo, a Japanese YouTuber who is a popular content creator, has expressed her love for India as her video dancing with Japanese Ambassador to India Hiroshi Suzuki to the tunes of Rajinikanth's hit song 'Kaavaalaa' from the film 'Jailer' goes viral. After the video of a Japanese man dancing to the song went viral, the Japanese envoy to India created a video with Japanese YouTuber Mayo in which he is seen shaking a leg to the track. During an exclusive conversation with ANI, YouTuber Mayo spoke about getting an education in Hindi and how she is fond of making videos in Hindi about Japan and India. While speaking to ANI, Mayo said that Rajinikanth is very famous in Japan and that she wanted to show her love for him. "The Japanese ambassador used to make a lot of videos about India and Japan. We then decided to collaborate on the video. I suggested Rajinikanth's song when collaborating because he is well-known and popular in Japan. There are numerous die-hard Rajnikanth fans in Japan. We wanted to express ouraffection for him," said Mayo here. The 'Jailer' song 'Kaavaalaa' featuring Tamannaah Bhatia and Rajinikanth has become extremely popular and the Japanese Ambassador to India, who is a huge fan of Rajinikanth himself, decided to record his version of the dance. Taking to X (formerly Twitter), he wrote,"Kaavaalaa dance video with Japanese YouTuber Mayo san(@MayoLoveIndia) My Love for Rajinikanth continues ... @Rajinikanth Jailer rajinifans..Video courtesy: Japanese Youtuber Mayo san and her team"In the video, the Japanese Ambassador embraces the iconic dance steps from the song. Earlier, Hiroshi Suzuki expressed his love for superstar Rajini taking up the'Thalaivar Challenge' where he had to flip his glasses like Rajnikanth. He also wished Rajinikanth great success for the film. He wrote on X (formerly Twitter),"Vannakkam!@Rajinikanth, Japan also loves you a lot!Jailer rajinifans""I saw Ambassador earlier doing his famous flipping glass shot and assumed he too is a big Rajni fan. That's why I suggested it to him, and so we did it jointly," said Mayo. 29-year-old Mayo speaks Hindi fluently and loves eating'Pani Puri'. She studied Hindi at Osaka University and spent over a year in Delhi, Mayo fell in love with India while pursuing her studies. Mayo one of the most famous Japanese YouTubers blogs on food, pop culture, travel and other aspects of life in India and Japan. Mayo told ANI that she was inspired by her father, who loved climbing in the Himalayas and told her how he loved India. Revealing that'RRR' was a big hit in Japan, Mayo hoped that the cultural understanding can be deeper between both countries. "I believe that cultural understanding between India and Japan may be improved. 'RRR' was a tremendous hit in Japan, and more and more Japanese people are falling in love with India. Most of them have never visited India, but they enjoy watching Indian entertainment. So I hope they visit Indiaand see the real India, and vice versa," said Mayo. Sung by Shilpa Rao and Anirudh Ravichander, the lyrics were penned by Arunraja Kamaraj. The dance moves of Tamannaah and Rajinikanth and the beats of the song from'Jailer' have made it viral and trending. (ANI)
news.author: Indian Air Force

news.title: Kamal Haasan Wishes His Indian Director S. Shankar On His 60th Birthday
news.text: Kamal Haasan Wishes His Indian Director S. Shankar On His 60th Birthday HomeEntertainmentKamal Haasan Wishes His Indian Director S. Shankar On His 60th Birthday Kamal Haasan Wishes His Indian Director S. Shankar On His 60th Birthday The actor and director will be reuniting for Indian 2 IANSUpdated: Thursday, August 17, 2023, 10:27 PM IST Ahead of the release of his upcoming action-thriller film 'Indian 2', veteran actor Kamal Haasan wished director Shankar Shanmugam (or Shankar) on his 59th birthday. Taking to his X account (formerly Twitter), the 'Vikram' actor sharing a picture of the two together tweeted: "Many happy returns of this day, Dear Shankar ji". Many fans congratulated the veteran Tamil director on his birthday while referring to the two as the 'power-packed danger duo'. After his success with the 2022 version of his 1986 spy-thriller film 'Vikram', Kamal Haasan, who is now over 68 still has the same level of energy. Read Also Kamal Haasan Or Rajinikanth As Ken? AI Reimagines Tamil Superstars In Barbieverse 'Indian 2' is the sequel to Shankar Shanmugam's 1996 Tamil vigilante action classic 'Indian' which also starred Kamal Haasan in the lead alongside Nedumudi Venu, Sukanya, Manisha Koirala and Urmila Matondkar. The original movie followed the character of Senaputhy, a veteran freedom fighter from Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose' Indian National Army, who turns into a brutal vigilante to root out corruption and crime, all the while sitting on the crossroads against his own son who is at the opposite end of the spectrum. This time too, Kamal Hasaan will reprise his role as Senapathy and the movie will be set 26 years after the events of the first film, where Senapathy, though old, is still going strong on his mission. Read Also Friendship Day 2023: Mohanlal-Mammootty, Rajinikanth-Kamal Haasan, Chiranjeevi-Nagarjuna: 20 Magical... Shankar is one of Tamil film industry's most renowned directors, with his films typically focusing outside mainstream topics and instead hone in on issues related to corruption, crime, vigilantism, technology and more. He's also known for his use of VFX and practical effects in movies such as 'Enthiran', '2.0', 'Mudhalvan' and all three parts of the Vikram-starrer 'Anniyan' action-psychological-thriller trilogy. Most details for the film have been kept under the wraps, though it is posing itself as another brooding and dark film with Kamal Hasaan bringing out his full 'Vikram' energy. news.title: OMG 2 box office collection Day 10: Akshay Kumar film holds its ground amidst Jailer-Gadar 2 rampage
news.text: In spite of Rajinikanth's Jailer and Sunny Deol’s Gadar 2 dominating the box-office scene and setting new records, Akshay Kumar's OMG 2 is consistently keeping up its pace and once again proved its appeal among audiences on Sunday. While both Jailer and Gadar 2 earned over Rs 40 crore on their respective release days, OMG 2 managed a more modest Rs 10.26 crore on its opening day (August 11). Although many initially doubted the potential of the Akshay Kumar comedy drama against these massive films, the movie has since maintained its momentum and is gradually carving out a successful trajectory, similar to that of a sleeper hit. On its 10th day in theatres on Sunday, OMG 2 collected approximately Rs 12.70 crore (nett), according to early estimates shared by industry tracker Sacnilk, representing a growth of 20.61 per cent compared to the earnings on Saturday. This has taken its overall India nett to Rs 114.31 crore. Simultaneously, the movie has achieved a global total of Rs 142 crore, propelled by a domestic gross of Rs 120 crore and an additional Rs 22 crore from overseas collections. Meanwhile, the film is expected to earn about Rs 3.35 crore (nett) on Monday. On Sunday, the Akshay Kumar comedy drama witnessed an overall 58.05 per cent Hindi occupancy. Helmed by Amit Rai, OMG 2 stars Pankaj Tripathi, Yami Gautam, and Pavan Malhotra in key roles, alongside Akshay. Initially, during the morning shows, the movie recorded a substantial 32.59 per cent occupancy within the Hindi market. As the day unfolded, the percentages experienced a consistent increase: rising to 64.89 per cent during the afternoon shows and reaching 76.73 per cent during the evening shows. However, the film saw a dip in the occupancy for the night screenings and recorded 58 per cent. On the other hand, while Rajinikanth's Jailer recorded an India nett of Rs 18.5 crore on Sunday, Sunny Deol’s Gadar 2 eked out a monumental Rs 41 crore. Previously, amidst widespread rumours regarding the film’s budget, where a segment of social media suggested it exceeded Rs 150 crore, Ajit Andhare, the Chief Operating Officer (COO) of Viacom18 Studios, which co-produced the movie alongside Cape of Good Films and Wakaoo Films, had dispelled these speculations and firmly stated that the circulating figures are far from accurate. “The reports of the budget of OMG 2 are grossly exaggerated. On the contrary, Akshay (Kumar) didn’t charge a rupee in fee and in fact, walked alongside us in both the financial and creative risk involved in such a courageous film,” Andhare told Pinkvilla. Awarding 3.5 stars out of 5, The Indian Express’ Shubhra Gupta wrote in her review of OMG 2: “It’s been a while since I enjoyed an Akshay Kumar performance as much as this one. And I haven’t been taken by surprise as much as I was in OMG 2, in the best way possible.” View this post on Instagram A post shared by Anupam Kher (@anupampkher) Anupam Kher calls OMG 2 'spectacular, stylish and very important' Renowned actor Anupam Kher recently watched OMG 2, and heaped praise on the film and actor Akshay Kumar. Labelling the film as spectacular, stylish and very important, Kher noted on social media while sharing a photo with Akshay: "A film on #SexEducation with ease and wonderful aesthetics! It was houseful. Saw parents with their teenage children. Obviously the film has struck a chord with the audiences! Full marks to writer/director Amit Rai. Pankaj Tripathi is BRILLIANT. He makes acting look easy but I know there is huge preparation behind it. Yami Gautam is beautifully sharp & excellent. I loved Pavan Malhotra as the judge." He added, "The film’s star undoubtedly is my friend & #GOAT
news.author: Amit Rai

news.title: OMG 2 box office collection day 4: Pankaj Tripathi-Akshay Kumar film delivers better Monday than opening Friday, earns Rs 54.6 cr
news.text: Despite strong competition, Oh My God 2 (OMG 2) pulled people to the cinema halls in huge numbers on its first Monday (non-holiday). OMG 2 box office collection on Monday stood at Rs 11.50 crore (early estimates) and the film crossed the Rs 50 cr mark within four days of its release, bringing its total collection to Rs 54.61 cr, reported Sacnilk. It has become the second film after The Kerala Story to have a Monday better than its opening Friday. The film starring Pankaj Tripathi and Yami Gautam, with an extended cameo by Akshay Kumar, had hit the theatres along with Sunny Deol's masala entertainer Gadar 2. Down south, Rajinikanth's Jailer was also released on the same day. So, before the release, the trade pundits were wary about OMG 2 picking up at the ticket counters. However, a positive word of mouth from the audience and film critics aided the film. Meanwhile, Gadar 2 is also maintaining its momentum at the box office and has earned Rs 39 cr on its first Monday. OMG 2 opened at the box office with a Rs 10.26 cr collection, followed by Rs 15.30 cr on Saturday and Rs 17.55 cr on Sunday. The film comes almost a decade after the first film in the franchise OMG, starring Paresh Rawal and Akshay, impressed the cinephiles. The film's success comes as a breather to Akshay, who has had a dry spell at the ticket counters since his last five films (Selfiee, Ram Setu, Raksha Bandhan, Samrat Prithviraj and Bachchhan Paandey) tanked at the ticket counters. Now, Tuesday (August 15) being a holiday, there are chances for OMG 2 to pick up pace and grow at the ticket counters. The film, which was awarded an A certificate, delivers a message about sex education. Watch the trailer of OMG 2 here Film critic Shubhra Gupta wrote in her review, “Entering ‘OMG 2,’ I held some apprehensions. Given the backdrop of 2023 and the complexities of today’s India, could a film navigate religious themes without taking a didactic or biased stance? The sequel tactfully avoids the complexities of diversity by embracing a remarkably progressive and liberal viewpoint. It compels us to overlook the absence of representation from other faiths. The result is a captivating film that challenges the skepticism uninformed adults harbor towards our youth, as they explore their bodies with natural curiosity and openness."
news.author: Akshay Kumar

news.title: Japanese Man Dances To Tamannaah's 'Kaavaalaa' From The Film 'Jailer', Video Viral
news.text: The song 'Kaavaalaa' from the movie 'Jailer', starring Tamannaah Bhatia and Rajinikanth, has become a superhit, captivating the hearts of fans around the world.The dance moves featured in the song are being replicated in dance studios as both the film and the song continue to gain immense popularity. Tamannaah's appearance in the song is truly stunning, leaving a lasting impression. Numerous influencers on social media have shared videos of themselves dancing to this catchy tune. Now a new dance video related to this trending song has captured the attention of social media. In this video, a Japanese digital creator who goes by the name "kaketaku" has skillfully replicated Tamannaah's dance moves from the song. Kaketaku, who according to his Instagram bio is a dancer and choreographer, shared the video on Instagram with a caption that reads, "Kaavaalaa from Japan." View this post on Instagram He went to great lengths to imitate the same dance steps that Tamannaah Bhatia performed in the movie. The dance clip was posted a week ago, and it received an overwhelmingly positive response from the internet, with many expressing their admiration for his performance. The video has garnered an impressive view count of nearly 200,000 on social media platforms. Since being posted, it has been liked more than 29,000 times, and the numbers are only increasing. Several users left interesting comments on the dance video. "Myyy Gooodddd, Soooo Smooth, I Love Your Moves Bro, Keep Rocking, Lot's Of Love From Tamil Nadu," commented a user. "Superb and killing moves," wrote another user. "Totally different from real choreography," commented a third user.

news.title: Gadar 2 box office collection day 5: Sunny Deol film delivers biggest Independence Day haul in history, scores its biggest single day
news.text: Gadar 2 is poised to become one of the biggest, if not the biggest, Hindi film in history. The long-awaited sequel to the hit 2001 film Gadar: Ek Prem Katha has been on a rampage at the box office, and is showing no signs of slowing down. In fact, it registered its biggest single-day haul yet on Independence Day, when it collected Rs 55 crore, according to industry tracker Sacnilk's early estimates. This is the biggest Independence Day haul in the history of Indian cinema. Gadar 2's box office collection now stands at Rs 229 crore in India. The film had an overall occupancy of 88% across the Hindi belt, which is extraordinary. Gadar 2 is mainly targetted at North Indian audiences, while Rajinikanth's Jailer does even better business in the South. Directed by Anil Sharma, Gadar 2 clashed against OMG 2 on Friday, and according to a Box Office India report, the film could have done even better business had it been a solo release. BOI said that Gadar 2 faced capacity issues on Independence Day, with several single screen theatres unable to accommodate demand. Even though additional shows have been added, the film is exceeding expectations at the box office. Gadar 2 made Rs 40 crore on day one, Rs 43 crore on day two, Rs 51 crore on day three, Rs 38 crore on day four, and Rs 55 crore on day five, for a combined nett total of Rs 229 crore in India. The film will overtake the lifetime haul of The Kerala Story next, and after that, will set its sights on beating the all-time Hindi record set by Shah Rukh Khan-starrer Pathaan earlier this year. The action film made Rs 543 crore nett in India, and over Rs 1000 crore worldwide. Trade analyst Taran Adarsh tweeted asking his followers whether Gadar 2 will surpass lifetime business of Pathaan and emerge the highest grossing film in India in terms of its nett collections. The first Gadar, also directed by Anil Sharma, was a blockbuster in 2001, when it clashed against the acclaimed hit Lagaan. It finished with Rs 130 crore at the global box office, a record that Gadar 2 eviscerated in days. The film features returning actors Sunny Deol, Ameesha Patel, Utkarsh Sharma, and is set against the backdrop of the 1971 India-Pakistan War. Meanwhile, OMG 2 is also performing well at the box office, and has crossed the Rs 50 crore mark already.
news.author: Anil Sharma

news.title: OMG 2 box office collection Day 5: Akshay Kumar film posts its highest earning on Independence Day; earns Rs 73.67 cr
news.text: The Akshay Kumar, Pankaj Tripathi and Yami Gautam starrer OMG 2 witnessed its best day in the theatres on Tuesday, which happened to be the Independence Day holiday across the nation. The film grew manifold from its first day and earned Rs 18.50 cr on Tuesday, reported industry tracker Sacnilk. Currently, the film's total collection stands at Rs 73.67 cr and going by its performance at the ticket counters, it might cross the Rs 100 cr mark by the coming weekend. OMG 2 had a slow start at the box office as it earned Rs 10.26 cr on Friday. But it started picking up pace with positive word of mouth and registered a weekend collection of Rs 32.85 cr (Rs 15.3 cr on Saturday and Rs 17.55 cr on Sunday). Also, the film's first Monday was better than its opening day as it collected Rs 12.06 cr. OMG 2 had hit the theatres along with the actioner Gadar 2, which had a huge craze around it even before release. But, much to the surprise of the trade analysts, both the films managed to survive in the theatres simultaneously. Along with them, Rajinikanth's Jailer is also writing new box office records every day. However, the real test of all three releases begins now when the Independence Day long weekend is over. The film, written and directed by Amit Rai, is the second film in the OMG franchise, which was loved by the audience. Noting the upward trend in the box office numbers of OMG 2, film trade analyst Taran Adarsh took to X (formerly Twitter) and wrote, "Sure, #OMG is a brand, but the love #OMG2 is getting is reflecting in its #BO numbers… This franchise has only enhanced its status in the eyes and hearts of moviegoers." On Monday, the Multiplex Association of India (MAI) and Producers Guild of India (PGI) noted that the weekend which saw the release of OMG 2, Gadar 2 and Jailer, set a “new all-time theatrical gross box office record” in its 100 years of history. This came as a relief for the cinema exhibition industry which had been facing a difficult time since 2020 when the cinema halls were shut due to the coronavirus pandemic. Even after the reopening of the theatres, they found it tough to bring back people. However, it seems like the dry spell at the ticket counters is finally over.
news.author: Amit Rai

news.title: Gadar 2 Records Highest Independence Day Box Office Collection In The History Of Indian Cinema
news.text: HomeEntertainmentGadar 2 Records Highest Independence Day Box Office Collection In The History Of Indian Cinema Gadar 2 Records Highest Independence Day Box Office Collection In The History Of Indian Cinema The total box office collection of Gadar 2 in just five days has mounted to Rs 229 crore. FPJ Web DeskUpdated: Wednesday, August 16, 2023, 10:48 AM IST The much-anticipated film Gadar 2 has kicked off a storm at the box office and Sunny Deol has hammered down all previous records as the film has scripted history within just five days of its release. Gadar 2, which has wrecked havoc in theatres, has emerged to be the biggest ever Independence Day grosser in the history of Indian cinema. Gadar 2 shows no signs of slowing down; instead, it is only gaining more frenzy as days pass by. The film, which has been on a rampage at the box office, has already minted over Rs 200 crore in India alone, and it is no hurry to let the buzz fizzle out. August 11, Friday, was the biggest opening day of the year with four films clashing at the theatre, and Gadar 2 has clearly emerged to be the winner. Read Also Gadar 2 Success Bash: Sunny Deol, Jeetendra, Rakesh Roshan & Others Celebrate In Mumbai Gadar 2 scripts history on Independence Day On the occasion of Independence Day on Tuesday, Gadar 2 recorded a whopping Rs 55 crore, it's highest ever single-day collection till date. And not just that, but with the staggering figure, the film has also emerged to have witnessed the biggest Independence Day haul in the history of Indian cinema. The total box office collection of Gadar 2 in just five days has mounted to Rs 229 crore. Gadar 2 has now become the second highest grosser of the year, the first one being Shah Rukh Khan's Pathaan, and if the current mania continues, then it would not be surprising if the Sunny Deol-starrer beats SRK's film too in the race. Read Also Sunny Deol On Gadar 2's Success: We Were Told That The Film Will Not Work About Gadar 2 Gadar 2 recorded the second highest opening of the year with Rs 40 crore on Friday, followed by Rs 43 crore on Saturday, Rs 51 crore on Sunday and Rs 38 crore on Monday. Gadar 2 brought back the iconic jodi of Sunny Deol and Ameesha Patel on the silver screens after over two decades. And it also introduced two new faces -- Utkarsh Sharma as Tara Singh's son and Simrat Kaur, his love interest in Pakistan. Directed by Anil Sharma, Gadar 2 has also become the biggest film of both Sunny and Ameesha's careers. news.title: Mansoor Ali Khan: ‘In one film, my salary was 4 lakhs and Vijay’s was only 2… He has now come this far’
news.text: If the devil-may-care attitude had a face, it would look like Tamil actor Mansoor Ali Khan. The veteran actor, who was once a dreaded onscreen villain, is also known for adding sarcastic humour to his villain roles. Lokesh Kanagaraj once revealed that he wrote Kaithi with Mansoor Ali Khan as the protagonist, but the film later starred Karthi in the lead role. However, in Vijay's Leo, Mansoor is finally teaming up with Lokesh. In a recent interview, the actor shared his experience of working with Vijay. Leo is not the first collaboration between Vijay and Mansoor. He was part of Vijay's debut film Naalya Theerppu. Minsaara Kanna, Deva, Maanbumigu Manavan, and Sendhoorapandi are the other collaborations between the two actors. After a long time, Leo has brought them together. Talking about Vijay's formative years, Mansoor said, "To be frank, back then for one film I was paid Rs 4 lakhs, and Vijay was paid only 2 lakhs. He has come from that stage because of his effort." He added, "For him, it's all cinema. He shoots 40 takes for a dance step. If it had been me, I would dance twice and would have left saying that's all I can do. But Vijay is spending so much time on a single shot. They have sculpted Leo scene by scene." The actor also shared about working with Anurag Kashyap. "I saw in papers that Anurag Kashyap wanted to act in Lokesh's film and die in it. A few days later, I see him sitting opposite me. He came and fired his gun 'tup tup'. Aiyayo (realises he is revealing too much about the film). Get lost man. I won't tell anything about Leo, go away." Mansoor also revealed why he missed out on acting in Kaithi. "I was asked to meet SR Prabhu, the producer of Kaithi. Lokesh had told him that I should play the role. However, when the opportunity came my way, I was arrested (for protesting against a government scheme) and sent to Puzhal jail. They wouldn't have shared this detail for obvious reasons." Over the years, Mansoor Ali Khan has acted alongside all the top stars of Tamil cinema including Rajinikanth, Ajith Kumar, and Vijayakanth. He is noted for his roles in films like Minsaara Kanna, Naanum Rowdy Dhaan, Captain Prabhakaran, and Asuran.

news.title: First Gadar, Now Gadar 2: Sunny Deol's Dhai Kilo Ka Haath Pounds Box Office
news.text: Gadar 2, starring Sunny Deol and Ameesha Patel, is absolutely destroying the Bollywood box office and truth be told, nobody's surprised. The film set expectations high even before it released with massive advance bookings and reality is matching up – unlike the Adipurush story, Gadar 2's ticket sales are on the uptick. The film raked in over Rs 55 crore on August 15, reported trade analyst Taran Adarsh - the biggest number notched up by an film so far on Independence Day. Gadar 2 has raced past the 200 crore mark on Day 5; its earnings at the end of Tuesday were over Rs 228 crore. Gadar 2 released last Friday with Akshay Kumar's OMG 2 – partly why it faced capacity issues on Tuesday. "The demand is clearly more than the supply," Taran Adarsh wrote in his report. While Gadar 2 is the clear winner in this box office clash, OMG 2 has also performed exceptionally well – both films could have made more with solo releases, according to Mr Adarsh. See his posts here: CREATES HISTORY ON INDEPENDENCE DAY… Highest-ever biz on *15 August*… Yes, #Gadar2 hits the ball out of the stadium on #IndependenceDay… Fri 40.10 cr, Sat 43.08 cr, Sun 51.70 cr, Mon 38.70 cr, Tue 55.40 cr. Total: ₹ 228.98 cr. #India biz… BLOCKBUSTER RUN continues.#Gadar2… pic.twitter.com/u3jJZpa5Je— taran adarsh (@taran_adarsh) August 16, 2023 #OMG2 is trending EXCEPTIONALLY WELL, the jump on #IndependenceDay is an EYE-OPENER… Fri 10.26 cr, Sat 15.30 cr, Sun 17.55 cr, Mon 12.06 cr, Tue 17.10 cr. Total: ₹ 72.27 cr. #India biz… #OMG2 is displaying strong legs at the #BO.Let's face it, the clash with #Gadar2 has… pic.twitter.com/5LSs6GDtyT— taran adarsh (@taran_adarsh) August 16, 2023 PVR Cinemas has credited Gadar 2 as well as OMG 2, Rajinikanth's Jailer and Chiranjeevi's Bhola Shankar with crafting a record weekend in the century-long history of Indian cinema. Cinema is shattering records, and how!

news.title: OMG 2 box office collection Day 6: Akshay Kumar-starrer passes Rs 100 crore mark worldwide
news.text: The satirical comedy-drama OMG 2, featuring actor Akshay Kumarin an extended cameo, crossed the Rs 100 crore gross mark globally on Wednesday. After a decent Rs 10 crore opening, the film gained traction with positive word of mouth. It earned an impressive Rs 17 crore on Tuesday (Independence Day), and added Rs 7.75 crore on Wednesday, according to industry tracker Sacnilk. The total collection of the film now stands at Rs 80 crore. OMG 2 had an overall 30.69% Hindi occupancy on Wednesday Starring Akshay Kumar, Yami Gautam and Pankaj Tripathi, the film is helmed by Amit Rai. OMG 2 clashed with Sunny Deol’s Gadar 2, Rajinikanth’s Jailer and Chiranjeevi’s Bhola Shankar. Gadar 2, the sequel to Gadar: Ek Prem Katha, took the box office by storm after raking in Rs 40.10 crore on its opening day. #OMG2 is trending EXCEPTIONALLY WELL, the jump on #IndependenceDay is an EYE-OPENER… Fri 10.26 cr, Sat 15.30 cr, Sun 17.55 cr, Mon 12.06 cr, Tue 17.10 cr. Total: ₹ 72.27 cr. #India biz… #OMG2 is displaying strong legs at the #BO. Let’s face it, the clash with #Gadar2 has… pic.twitter.com/5LSs6GDtyT — taran adarsh (@taran_adarsh) August 16, 2023 OMG 2 is the sequel to the 2012 hit OMG - Oh My God! The new film has now earned the same amount as the first one. The original movie, starring Akshay Kumar, Paresh Rawal, and Mithun Chakraborty, collected Rs 81.46 crore during its run. OMG 2 is produced by Cape of Good Films, Ashwin Varde, Vipul D Shah and Rajesh Bahl. The Indian Express' Shubhra Gupta gave the film 3.5 stars. A part of the review read, “I went into OMG 2 with a great deal of trepidation. This is 2023, and a different India. It’s been a while since I enjoyed an Akshay Kumar performance as much as this one. And I haven’t been taken by surprise as much as I was in OMG 2, in the best way possible.”

news.title: Andhra Pradesh: Another leopard captured on Tirumala walkway, second in a week
news.text: A week after a 6-year-old girl was killed in a leopard attack on the Tirumala walkway in Andhra Pradesh, forest officials captured a second leopard from the area on Thursday morning. According to sources, the female leopard was trapped in a cage at the same spot where another leopard was trapped three days ago. They said cages were set up at three different spots, including Mokali Mitta, Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy Temple, and at the 35th turn atop the hill. A forest department official said the leopard was trapped in a cage that was set up at the Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy Temple in Tirupati. He said the authorities had trapped three leopards in 50 days. Tirupati Divisional Forest Officer (DFO) Satish Reddy said, “We found two leopards within a 500 m radius of the Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy Temple in a week and it was the third capture in 50 days.” He said they had moved another trapped leopard to the Sri Venkateswara Zoological Park in Tirupati three days ago, adding that trap cameras had been set up for leopards.He said the leopard got trapped in the cage at 2 am and was being moved to the SV Zoo. The senior forest official said veterinarians were checking if there was any human flesh in the freshly captured leopard’s stomach.He said the forest department will take a call on whether to keep it in the zoo or release it into the forest. “We have set up around 320 cameras to track leopards. Trap cameras have also been set up on the Srivari Mettu path (the shortest way to reach Tirumala on foot),” he said.Edited By: Poulami KunduPublished On: Aug 17, 2023ALSO READ | Rajinikanth's 'Jailer' beats Chiranjeevi's 'Bholaa Shankar' in Andhra Pradesh, TelanganaALSO READ | Schoolgirl suffers seizures, drowns in canal in Andhra Pradesh

news.title: Ambassador Of Japan To India Dances To 'Jailer' Song, Says 'My Love For Rajinikanth Continues' - Jammu Kashmir Latest News
news.text: New Delhi, Aug 17: Superstar Rajinikanth has a fan in Ambassador of Japan to India Hiroshi Suzuki, whose video of dancing to the actor’s song “Kaavaalaa” from his latest release “Jailer” is going viral on social media. Suzuki shared the 17-second clip on his official X page on Wednesday, in which he can be seen shaking a leg to the popular Tamil track — originally featuring Rajinikanth and Tamannaah Bhatia — with Japanese YouTuber Mayo. “Kaavaalaa dance video with Japanese YouTuber Mayo san (@MayoLoveIndia) My Love for Rajinikanth continues… @Rajinikanth #Jailer #rajinifans,” the ambassador captioned the post. Suzuki’s post has garnered close to 820,000 views and over 300 comments on the microblogging site. Mayo also shared the video on her official X page and thanked Suzuki for being such a sport. “Dance collaboration with Ambassador Suzuki at the Embassy of Japan in India. Ambassador Suzuki, you are wonderful! thank you very much!!” the influencer wrote in Japanese on X. Rajinikanth enjoys a massive fan following in Japan after a dubbed version of his 1995 Tamil film “Muthu” was released in 1998 and became a surprise hit at the box office there. The superstar has been popular in the country ever since. Recently, a Japanese couple visited Chennai during the “Jailer” release on August 10 to experience the festive mood that marks every Rajinikanth movie premiere in south. “Jailer” has minted Rs 375.40 crores in the first week of its release, according to production house Sun Pictures. The earnings were the “highest 1st week gross collection in the history of Tamil cinema”, the banner added in an X post. Directed by Nelson Dilipkumar, “Jailer” also features Vinayakan and Ramya Krishnan. (Agencies)

news.title: Gadar 2 box office collection Day 7: Sunny Deol film crosses Rs 300 crore mark in India, to enjoy second successful weekend
news.text: Gadar 2, featuring Sunny Deol and Ameesha Patel in the lead roles, is asserting its dominance at the box office, consistently enticing thousands of film lovers to theatres even during weekdays, in stark contrast to the prevailing Bollywood trends observed since the Covid era commenced. The film's triumphant momentum shows no signs of waning, as it achieved a noteworthy collection of Rs 22 crore on its seventh day of release on Thursday, according to early estimates shared by industry tracker Sacnilk. With this, Gadar 2's total earnings in the domestic market have now reached an impressive nett earning of Rs 283.35 crore. The film's domestic gross collection stands at Rs 308.5 crore. The industry tracker has also predicted that the movie is poised to generate around Rs 17 crore on Friday, pushing it beyond the Rs 300-crore mark in the domestic market in just eight days. Gadar 2 records overall 35.06 per cent Hindi occupancy On Thursday, the period action drama also recorded an overall 35.06 per cent Hindi occupancy. While the film witnessed a 16.17 per cent occupancy in the Hindi market for morning shows, as the day progressed, the percentages steadily surged, reaching 29.20 per cent for afternoon shows, 41.77 per cent for evening shows, and 53.09 per cent for night shows. With no big releases on Friday, the film will enjoy another smooth weekend at the box office. While the film is still in its first week in theatres, it has already become the second-highest domestic grosser of the year, after Pathaan. Gadar 2 had earlier crossed The Kerala Story’s lifetime collection of Rs 242.20 crore. Gadar 2 was released on August 11 and started its box office journey with Rs 40.1 crore on its opening day. The film has been performing exceedingly well at the cinemas despite competition from Rajinikanth-starrer Jailer, Akshay Kumar's OMG 2, and Alia Bhatt-Ranveer Singh film Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani. Directed by Anil Sharma and bankrolled by Zee Studio and Anil Sharma Productions, Gadar 2 is the sequel to the 2001 hit Gadar, which was one of the highest grossers of that year.
news.author: Anil Sharma

news.title: Akshay Kumar did OMG 2 for free, says producer Ajit Andhare: ‘Reports of film’s budget hugely exaggerated’
news.text: Even in the face of strong competition posed by Superstar Rajinikanth's Jailer and Sunny Deol’s Gadar 2, Akshay Kumar's OMG 2 is delivering an impressive box office performance, effectively bringing an end to the challenging phase that the Selfiee actor was experiencing. While Gadar 2 is clearly leading the box office charts in the northern states, OMG 2 has managed to amass an impressive nett total of Rs 84.72 crore domestically and a global collection of Rs 111.8 crore, according to industry tracker Sacnilk. Amidst widespread rumours regarding the film's budget, where a segment of social media suggests it exceeds Rs 150 crore, Ajit Andhare, the Chief Operating Officer (COO) of Viacom18 Studios, which co-produced the movie alongside Cape of Good Films and Wakaoo Films, has dispelled these speculations and firmly stated that the circulating figures are far from accurate. “The reports of the budget of OMG 2 are grossly exaggerated. On the contrary, Akshay (Kumar) didn't charge a rupee in fee and in fact, walked alongside us in both the financial and creative risk involved in such a courageous film," Andhare told Pinkvilla. "We share a long history & understanding with him as a Studio since OMG, Special 26, and Toilet: Ek Prem Katha and I have been totally in lockstep with him in taking up scripts that are unconventional but stand for something larger and meaningful. Without him this risk was impossible to take, he was fully invested both creatively and financially,” he added. Helmed by Amit Rai, OMG 2 stars Pankaj Tripathi, Yami Gautam, and Pavan Malhotra in key roles, alongside Akshay Kumar. A big thank you to our audiences for all the love for #OhMyGadar and giving us the greatest week in Indian Film History! प्यार और आभार
news.author: Amit Rai

news.title: Workers In India Are Getting The Day Off To See A New Hit Film - WorldNewsEra
news.text: Box office numbers can only tell you so much about a film’s success. Sure, you get the hard dollar amounts. But ticket sales alone can’t justify cultural movements. RRR, the South Indian film that rode an international wave of success to an Oscars win for best Original Song, could be seen in its home country for 75 rupees (just under one US dollar). With ticket prices like that, you’re not going to top the worldwide box office. And yet, RRR still became the 31st highest-grossing film of 2022 once it hit international theaters. Now, India has another massive success on their hands. Jailer, a Tamil-language action film starring legendary Indian actor Rajinikanth, is so popular that workers are being given the day off by their employers to go and see the film. According to CNN, an education company called Redbooks Abroad even bought their entire staff tickets. “We hope that this day off and movie experience will bring joy, relaxation, and renewed energy to you all. Let us cherish this moment and create memories together,” an internal memo read. “Relax, rejoice, and immerse yourselves in the magic of the silverscreen.” Le Hive, a restaurant in Tamil Nadu, joked that they also gave their staff half the day off to, “avoid sudden sick leaves.”

news.title: Karan Johar’s Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani touches Rs 300 cr globally, director says he is ‘humbled and grateful’
news.text: Actors Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt's family drama Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani has crossed the Rs 300 crore mark globally. Karan Johar's return to the (feature film) director's chair after seven years is being met with generosity and excitement by the audience, with the film delivering strong collections ever since it released on July 28. The filmmaker took to his Instagram account to spread the happy news. Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani also stars Dharmendra, Jaya Bachchan, Shabana Azmi, and Bengali actor Tota Roy Chowdhury. The film created a lot of buzz for being a quintessential Karan Johar film, with all his favourite elements of drama and grandeur. The film has so far collected Rs 140.02 crore net in India. Karan took to Instagram on Friday and posted a video announcing the Rs 300 cr milestone. In the caption, he wrote, "To know that our prem kahaani has reached the corners of the world and hearts…feeling humbled & grateful and especially for all the love you have given to #RockyAurRaniKiiPremKahaani!!! Thank you." Check out Karan Johar's post - View this post on Instagram A post shared by Karan Johar (@karanjohar) Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani follows the love story of two mismatched characters. However, the cultural and social differences between them and their families pose an obstacle. The two then come up with the plan of swapping families for a few months to understand each other's lifestyles and values. The film enjoyed a solid run for two weeks, despite Hollywood films Oppenheimer and Barbie already dividing box office numbers from the previous week, and big-ticket titles such as Sunny Deol's Gadar 2, Akshay Kumar's OMG 2, Rajinikanth's Jailer, and Chiranjeevi's Bholaa Shankar, taking up a lot of screens two weeks later. Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani marks the return of Karan Johar as a feature film director after seven years. His last full length directorial was Ae Dil Hai Mushkil.
