news.title: Aditi Govitrikar On Juggling Multiple Careers: ‘My Focus Has Been On My Skills & Passion’
news.text: Aditi Govitrikar On Juggling Multiple Careers: ‘My Focus Has Been On My Skills & Passion’ HomeEntertainmentAditi Govitrikar On Juggling Multiple Careers: ‘My Focus Has Been On My Skills & Passion’ Aditi Govitrikar On Juggling Multiple Careers: ‘My Focus Has Been On My Skills & Passion’ Aditi Govitrikar gets candid about her journey in the world of showbiz, and more Oshin FernandesUpdated: Friday, August 18, 2023, 10:07 PM IST Aditi Govitrikar On Juggling Multiple Careers: ‘My Focus Has Been On My Skills & Passion’ | Aditi Govitrikar who is currently heading the beauty pageant Marvelous Mrs India took the entertainment industry by storm when she became the first Indian woman to win the Mrs World title in 2001. Aditi has worked in films like 16 December, Paheli, De Dana Dan, and Koi Jaane Na to name a few. She has also been featured on the web series Mismatched. She can easily be defined as “beauty with brains”. Besides being an actress, she is also a doctor by profession. However, nothing compares to her role as a hands-on mother. In an exclusive chat with The Free Press Journal, Aditi opens up about her journey in showbiz. You have an envious bio. What is your secret to maintaining a work-life balance? It’s a constant effort to find balance even today, as there’s no one-size-fits-all solution, but a few key principles have helped me. Maintaining any kind of balance requires prioritisation, time management, delegation, self-care, communication, flexibility, saying no when necessary, setting realistic goals, mindfulness, and a strong support system from family and friends. Although I still have my days, I continue to learn and adjust as needed. View this post on Instagram Was your family supportive of entering the modelling world despite being a doctor? Yes, after the initial surprise of entering an industry, I never thought I would, my parents were surprisingly cool about it. They were and still are very supportive and motivating of everything I pursue. Do you think it was a risky move to enter showbiz? Yes and no. I mean, entering showbiz is indeed a risky move due to the competitive nature of the industry, unpredictable opportunities, and the need to navigate constant public scrutiny. But like any other field, it requires a strong sense of resilience, the will to continuously adapt, and handle both successes and setbacks. Despite the risks though, for those with a passion and a drive to succeed, like me, the personal growth and success I earned through my journey made it a worthwhile pursuit. View this post on Instagram Did you encounter any rejections along the way? Not really, my experience in the entertainment industry has been largely positive, albeit with some challenges along the way. As for rejections, they are a common part of the industry, but I always believe in persevering so that never phased me. Luckily, I’ve always been confident in my natural self and my focus has been on my skills and passion so, it helped me sail right through. Reality shows these days are completely different from the ones you've participated in. Your thoughts? Absolutely! Reality shows have undergone a significant transformation from when I participated. The influence of social media has revolutionised reach and fan engagement. It’s exciting to see the instant connection, but it also means being prepared for a more dynamic and media-savvy experience, including both positive and negative reviews and comments, which is definitely kinda scary however, the evolving landscape demands adaptability from both participants and the industry. You’re using social media to empower your followers, a bit different from your contemporaries. What made you take an unusual route? Absolutely, my approach to social media aims to empower my followers in a unique way. My page is a vibrant mix of content, ranging from DIY tips to help people identify and navigate various emotions and situations, to engaging reels that provide a glimpse into my life with family and friends. You’ll find a blend of workouts, insights into my work, and other exciting facets. Through this diverse content, I strive to create a positive and uplifting space where my followers can feel inspired, informed, and connected. Tamannaah is best-known for her performances in films like Baahubali, Devi, Sye Raa Narasimha Reddy and her recent releases also include Plan A Plan B and Babli Bouncer. On the work front, Vijay Varma will next be seen in Sujoy Ghosh's The Devotion Of Suspect X alongside Kareena Kapoor and Jaideep Ahlawat. The actor starred in the smash hit series Dahaad this year. news.title: Rajinikanth to watch Jailer with Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath in Lucknow
news.text: Even though Superstar Rajinikanth's Jailer released ten days ago, there are no indications of its box-office momentum waning. Trade expert Manobala Vijaybalan has forecasted that the film is likely to cross the Rs 500-crore mark worldwide on Saturday. Meanwhile, Rajinikanth is currently gearing up to take part in a screening of Jailer in Lucknow, where he will be accompanied by Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya will also attend the special screening of Jailer, helmed by Nelson Dilipkumar, in Lucknow. Upon his arrival in Lucknow on Friday, he conveyed to news agency ANI, "I will watch the film with the CM. It's God's blessing that the movie is becoming a hit." Ahead of the screening in Lucknow, Rajinikanth met Uttar Pradesh governor Anandiben Patel at the Raj Bhavan on Saturday. Ahead of the release of Jailer, the legendary actor had gone on a spiritual trip to the Himalayas. On Thursday, Rajinikanth also paid a visit to Jharkhand governor CP Radhakrishnan in Ranchi, after returning from his Himalayas tour. Radhakrishnan, hailing from Tamil Nadu, was the former state president of the Bharatiya Janata Party in the state. #WATCH | Actor Rajinikanth in Lucknow on being asked about his visit to Ayodhya tomorrow; says, "Jee kal program hai." pic.twitter.com/naUdniPd3N — ANI (@ANI) August 19, 2023 “On his arrival in Ranchi, delighted and very happy to meet my dear friend, one of India’s greatest Actors and great Human Being Superstar Shri. @rajinikanth Ji at Raj Bhavan yesterday on a courtesy meet. I heartily welcome him to the great land of Jharkhand,” Radhakrishnan wrote on Twitter while sharing images of him with the superstar. As per industry tracker Sacnilk, Jailer made Rs 9 crore on its ninth day of release on Friday, with Tamil occupancy leading at 34.53 per cent. The film’s total India nett collection now stands at Rs 244.85 crore.
news.author: Uttar Pradesh Chief

news.title: Jailer director Nelson says his calculations went wrong in Vijay’s Beast: ‘Had I invested six to seven more months…’
news.text: If we were to personify the phrase 'rise from the ashes', director Nelson Dilipkumar would undoubtedly exemplify it. Despite facing extensive trolling and criticism for his previous action-comedy film Beast, which featured Thalapathy Vijay in the lead role, Nelson recently staged a remarkable resurgence and delivered a significant blockbuster to the Tamil film industry, Jailer. The Rajinikanth-starrer has already established itself as the highest-grossing Tamil film of 2023 and will soon cross the Rs 500-crore mark worldwide. Nelson recently opened up about what went wrong in Beast, despite its launch with the momentum from his prior successful directorial ventures, Kolamaavu Kokila and Doctor, as well as the inclusion of Vijay. "Had I invested an additional six to seven months and meticulously crafted the movie, the responses to it might not have been so mixed. Initially, I believed I could finish the film within a set timeframe, but my calculations turned out to be inaccurate," Nelson expressed in a conversation with Film Companion. "The Covid outbreak disrupted our shooting plans, preventing us from executing them as intended. There was room for some enhancement in the VFX, and certain scenes were still pending to be filmed. Various challenges arose, leading to several issues during the production process," he added. Nelson Dilipkumar on what Vijay told him after Beast failure During a recent interview with Galatta Plus, Nelson had mentioned how Vijay reacted after Beast’s release. “To be frank, when the film was released, he told ‘We made a film. You made what you told me you will. We put in our best effort. Some liked it, and some didn’t. We can’t do anything about it now. Let’s try doing something better next time.' I then asked him if he is upset with me,” Nelson recalled. "He looked perplexed and asked ‘Why would I be pissed with you?’ I told him because the film is only getting a mixed response. He said ‘Yov (Arre)’ and left. He then came back and asked ‘So, our friendship is nothing more than a film, is it? You have hurt me by asking this'”. Stating that Vijay congratulated him following the success of Jailer, Nelson said: “He texted me saying he is happy about the success. That’s how we are. People keep saying a lot of things. It is better not to respond to all of that.” Apart from Vijay, Beast also starred Pooja Hegde, Selvaraghavan, Shaji Chen, VTV Ganesh, and Ankur Vikal in key roles. Bankrolled by Kalanithi Maran for Sun Pictures, Beast minted approximately Rs 216.58 crore worldwide, according to the industry tracker Sacnilk, surpassing its budget of about Rs 150 crore.

news.title: India’s Best Dancer 3: Dream Girl 2 Actor Ayushmann Khurrana Reveals His Admiration For Sonali Bendre
news.text: India’s Best Dancer 3: Dream Girl 2 Actor Ayushmann Khurrana Reveals His Admiration For Sonali Bendre HomeEntertainmentIndia’s Best Dancer 3: Dream Girl 2 Actor Ayushmann Khurrana Reveals His Admiration For Sonali Bendre India’s Best Dancer 3: Dream Girl 2 Actor Ayushmann Khurrana Reveals His Admiration For Sonali Bendre Actor and his Dream Girl 2 co-star Ananya Panday graced the reality show to promote their film CJ DeskUpdated: Saturday, August 19, 2023, 08:20 PM IST Today, the dance reality show, India’s Best Dancer 3, is set to captivate audiences with its enthralling ‘Dream Girl Special’. Gracing the episode will be the charismatic duo – Ayushmann Khurrana and Ananya Panday, who will be promoting their upcoming film, Dream Girl 2. Making it a dreamy extravaganza, the contestants will strive to impress the judges and the special guests with their awe-inspiring dance moves. One of the highlights of the episode will be the scintillating performance by contestant Boogie LLB and choreographer Saumya Kamble. The duo will set the stage ablaze with their electrifying moves, choreographed to the iconic song Mukkala Mukabala, and will receive a huge round of applause from all. Ayushmann Khurrana on the sets of India’s Best Dancer 3 | Judge Geeta Kapur will complement the duo’s performance, saying, “Boogie, you are flawless when you perform solo. I couldn’t take my eyes off you. I often revisit Boogie’s performances, as there are truly astonishing aspects. Your style is executed so beautifully. And while you are an incredible performer, your choreographer, Soumya, contributes significantly to enhancing your dancing prowess.” She adds, “The way you both complement each other is commendable. Even if there are minor imperfections, Soumya’s ability to camouflage them is truly remarkable. Soumya, you are a fantastic choreographer. It is because of this synergy that Boogie is flourishing. I was enamoured by this act and admire your artistic finesse.” Adding to the excitement, Boogie showcased his poetic skill by dedicating a heartfelt shayari to Ananya. Impressed by this gesture, Ananya will thank Boogie. “I love his Shayari,” she states. Read Also India’s Best Dancer 3: Abhishek Bachchan Reveals He Played Cupid Between THIS Bollywood Couple The magic of the evening further intensifies as Ayushmann takes a heartfelt moment to express his admiration for the beautiful Sonali Bendre. “I’m a big fan of Sonali ma’am. We both were a part of India’s Got Talent, where she graced the judge’s panel, and I hosted the show. Ever since, I’ve been smitten by Sonali ma’am. My admiration for her has only grown over time. I had even sung a song for her back then,” he gushes. Recreating the moment once again, Ayushmann serenaded the audience with the soulful song Akeli Na Bazar Jaya Karo from the movie Major Saab (1998), dedicating it to Sonali Bendre. news.title: Gadar 2 box office collection day 9: Sunny Deol-starrer records biggest second Saturday of all time, inches towards Rs 400 crore
news.text: The movie Gadar 2, starring Sunny Deol and Ameesha Patel, is doing incredibly well at the box office, and it recently crossed the Rs 300 crore mark in India. After making Rs 20.5 crore on Friday, it jumped by 55 percent on its second Saturday, collecting Rs 32 crore, according to industry analyst Sacnilk. So far, the movie has collected a total of Rs 336.13 crore in India and Rs 395.1 crores worldwide. This is the biggest second Saturday of all time, ahead of Baahubali 2: The Conclusion (Rs 26.5 crore), The Kashmir Files (Rs 24.8 crore) and Pathaan (Rs 22 crore). The movie is expected to have a big second weekend, with Sacnilk predicting that it might earn Rs 40 crore on Sunday. Despite competition from Rajinikanth's Jailer and Akshay Kumar's OMG 2, Gadar 2 had a strong start, earning an impressive Rs 40 crores on its first day. Gadar 2 has even outperformed Salman Khan's Bajrangi Bhaijaan (Rs 320 crore), and by tomorrow, it's set to surpass Tiger Zinda Hai (Rs 339 crore), PK (Rs 340 crore) and Sanju (Rs 342 crore) to become the fifth-highest grossing Hindi movie ever at the domestic box office. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Zee Studios (@zeestudiosofficial) After Shah Rukh Khan's Pathaan, Gadar 2 is the biggest post-pandemic hit of the Hindi industry. Other films like Tu Jhoothi Main Makkkar, Satyaprem Ki Katha, and Kerala Story also fared well at the box office. Helmed by Anil Sharma, Sunny and Ameesha reprise their roles as Tara Singh and Sakina in the film. Gadar 2 also stars Utkarsh Sharma. The Indian Express critic Shubhra Gupta gave the film 1.5 stars and said that the film offers 'nothing new.' A part of the review read, "This iteration just reminds of you the loudness and the saccharine and the over-the-top dialoguing that new Bollywood had started shaking off, which we hoped was safely behind us. Clearly, in vain."
news.author: Anil Sharma

news.title: Jailer box office collection Day 10: Rajinikanth-starrer crosses Rs 500 crore mark, sees a spike on second Saturday
news.text: Superstar Rajinikanth’s actioner Jailer continues to entertain audiences even in its second week. On its second Saturday, the film clocked a massive collection of Rs 18 crore (nett) at the box office. As per the industry tracker Sacnilk, the growth is around 80 percent from Friday's numbers, bringing its 10-day collection to Rs 245.9 crore in India. Jailer had 53.79 percent occupancy in the Tamil-speaking market and 46.73 percent in Telugu. Gadar 2 and OMG 2 continue to dominate the Hindi belt. While Abhishek Bachchan's Ghoomer was also released this Friday, it saw dismal numbers. Jailer has also managed to cross Rs 500 crore worldwide. As per industry analyst Manobala Vijayabalan, the Rajinikanth film crossed the big mark on its 10th day of release. It also became the third Tamil film to enter the club after 2.0 and Ponniyin Selvan: I. Jailer is the second-fastest film to cross the Rs 500 mark, after Rajinikanth-Akshay Kumar's 2.0 which earned the big number in just seven days. The Nelson Dilipkumar directorial also stars Tamannaah Bhatia in a pivotal role and tells the story of a man who is out to avenge his cop son’s death. The film also stars Mohanlal, Jackie Shroff and Shivarajkumar in significant roles. Besides them, the movie also features Priyanka Mohan, Ramya Krishnan, Yogi Babu, Vasanth Ravi and Vinayakan. Pointing out that Rajinikanth and Nelson Dilipkumar rediscover the alchemy of a good masala film, the Indian Express’ Kirubhakar Purushothaman wrote in his review of the film: “Jailer is Rajinikanth’s version of Kamal Haasan’s Vikram, but with a twist. Saying that doesn’t take away anything from this fun-filled entertainer.” Rajinikanth meets Yogi Adiyanath Meanwhile, Rajinikanth was part of a special screening of Jailer in Lucknow, where he was joined by Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya also attended the special screening. Videos of Rajinikanth bowing to touch Yogi's feet have gone viral on social media, invoking mixed reaction from fans. Ahead of the screening in Lucknow, Rajinikanth met Uttar Pradesh governor Anandiben Patel at the Raj Bhavan on Saturday. The pictures of Rajinikanth’s visit were posted on the official Twitter handle of the Governor of Uttar Pradesh. Rajini is also scheduled to visit Ayodhya on Sunday. Ahead of the release of Jailer, the legendary actor had gone on a spiritual trip to the Himalayas. On Thursday, the superstar had also paid a visit to Jharkhand governor CP Radhakrishnan in Ranchi, after returning from his Himalayas tour. Radhakrishnan, hailing from Tamil Nadu, was the former state president of the Bharatiya Janata Party.
news.author: Uttar Pradesh Chief

news.title: Ghoomer box office collection day 2: Abhishek Bachchan’s sports drama bowled out with just Rs 2 crore in two days
news.text: Abhishek Bachchan-led Ghoomer was released in theatres on Friday, amid the Gadar 2 madness at the box office. With Sunny Deol's period drama sequel is keeping audiences enthralled in theatres, the R Balki sports drama did not find many takers. After a dismal opening of Rs 85 lakh, the film only managed to collect Rs 1.2 crore (nett) on Saturday. The film's two-day collections stand at Rs 2 crore, as per industry tracker Sacnilk. The website also said that Ghoomer had an overall 29.97 percent occupancy in the Hindi-speaking market. Night shows saw the maximum audience, followed by evening, afternoon and morning shows. On the other hand, Sunny Deol's Gadar 2 has collected a total of Rs 336.13 crore in India and Rs 395.1 crores worldwide. Akshay Kumar-Pankaj Tripathi's OMG 2 also is doing fair business and has already crossed Rs 100 crore. Rajinikanth's actioner Jailer also saw a spike in its second week and has managed to mint more than Rs 500 crore in 10 days, worldwide. Ghoomer also stars Saiyami Kher, Shabana Azmi and Angad Bedi. It tells the tale of a young cricketer who loses her right arm in an accident. An alcoholic coach takes it on himself to train her to bowl with her left hand. The film celebrates her triumph over adversity. Indian Express' Shubhra Gupta gave Ghoomer a 2.5-star rating, and wrote in her review, "In keeping its gaze so firmly on the reluctant student-strict teacher duo, the film reduces the other characters to the periphery." Saiyami Kher thanks fans for loving Ghoomer: "If you had told me a few years ago, that I’d wake up reading the praise which I’ve received for Ghoomer, I would have never believed you. I didn’t have that faith in myself, leave alone anyone else instilling it in me. It’s hard to explain what this film means to me," she tweeted in gratitude.
news.author: Karnataka HC

news.title: OMG! Gadar 2 Star Sunny Deols Mumbai Villa To Be Auctioned For Non-Payment Of Dues Amounting To ₹56 Crore
news.text: OMG! Gadar 2 Star Sunny Deol's Mumbai Villa To Be Auctioned For Non-Payment Of Dues Amounting To ₹56 Crore HomeEntertainmentOMG! Gadar 2 Star Sunny Deol's Mumbai Villa To Be Auctioned For Non-Payment Of Dues Amounting To ₹56 Crore OMG! Gadar 2 Star Sunny Deol's Mumbai Villa To Be Auctioned For Non-Payment Of Dues Amounting To ₹56 Crore The Mumbai studio will be e-auctioned on September 25 due to non-payment of nearly Rs 56 crore FPJ Web DeskUpdated: Sunday, August 20, 2023, 12:55 PM IST Sunny Deol | File photo by Viral Bhayani Bollywood actor-politician Sunny Deol's villa in Juhu, Mumbai, is all set to be auctioned in September 2023 for non-payment of dues amounting to nearly Rs 56 crore. The actor is currently enjoying the success of Gadar 2 which has collected Rs 336 crore within nine days of its theatrical release. According to a notice published by Bank Of Baroda in The Free Press Journal, the villa will be e-auctioned on September 25 due to non-payment of Rs 55,99,80,766. The notice also mentions that Sunny Deol, whose real name is Ajay Singh, is the borrower and guarantor and that he has failed to pay the above mentioned figure to the bank on time. Read Also Sunny Deol Quashes Reports Of Border Sequel Amid Gadar 2 Success: 'Have NOT Signed Any Film' The villa, located at Gandhigram Road in Juhu, houses Sunny Super Sound, which is a post-production studio. Several Bollywood celebrities are often spotted outside the studio. A lot of films are also screened here. According to a report in Bollywood Hungama, after paying the amount at auction, the buyer will only get the symbolic possession of the property. Also, Sunny Deol can operate his business from Sunny Villa until the District Magistrate approves to give the physical possession to the buyer. View this post on Instagram Meanwhile, the actor is currently enjoying the success of his latest film Gadar 2, which is a sequel to his 2001 film Gadar. Directed by Anil Sharma, the film entered the Rs 300 crore club within just eight days of its release. In the film, he reprises his role as Tara Singh, and Ameesha Patel is seen as Sakeena. Gadar 2 is based on the backdrop of the 1971 India-Pakistan war. The film also features Utkarsh Sharma, Luv Sinha, Simrat Kaur, Gaurav Chopra and Manish Wadhwa in significant roles. news.title: Jailer box officer collection Day 11: Rajinikanth’s latest is expected to become highest-grossing Tamil film
news.text: While Rajinikanth's act of touching the feet of Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath seems to have disappointed many down South, the Superstar's Jailer continues to live up to audiences' expectations. On Day 11, the masala film, directed by Nelson Dilipkumar, is still having good momentum at the box office. According to Sacnilk, the movie earned Rs 18.5 crore on its second Sunday at the Indian box office. The number is a significant rise from its nationwide collection on Day 10: Rs 16.25 crore. Earlier, film trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan tweeted that the movie has crossed the Rs 500 crore mark at the box office worldwide. However, a Sacnilk report claims that the film has minted only Rs 477.6 crore so far. The report also stated that the movie has so far collected Rs 280 crore from across the nation with an average occupancy of more than 50 per cent in most of the cities and towns in Tamil Nadu. Earlier, speaking to The Indian Express, film trade analyst Ramesh Bala predicted that Jailer will earn Rs 700 crore (lifetime collection). If the movie continues its current pace at the box office, it also has a chance to touch Rs 800 crore and become the highest-grossing Tamil film. Currently, Rajinikanth's 2.0 holds the top spot, which might get conquered yet again by the Superstar. Also starring Jackie Shroff, Mohanlal, Shivrajkumar, and Kishore in cameos, Jailer follows the story of a retired police officer, who uses his connections with former prisoners to save his son from a gangster. Rajinikanth will next team up with director TJ Gnanvel, who shot to fame with the film Jai Bhim, starring Suriya. The movie is currently referred to as Thalaivar 170, denoting the number of films in Rajini's career. It is now rumoured that the film will be titled Vettaiyan. Another rumour about the actor is that he is set to join Lokesh Kanagaraj's cinematic universe.
news.author: Nelson Dilipkumar

news.title: Gadar 2 box office collection day 10: Sunny Deol-starrer set to cross Rs 400 crore mark
news.text: The fervour surrounding Gadar 2 shows no signs of abating. Following its record-breaking second Saturday collection of Rs 31.07 crore, the film added Rs 41 crore to its Indian box office haul on Sunday, August 20, according to industry tracker Sacnilk. The Sunny Deol and Ameesha Patel-starrer, which is rewriting box office records at a remarkable pace, has now amassed a staggering total of Rs 377.20 crore and is set to cross the Rs 400 crore mark soon. In the face of competition from Rajinikanth's Jailer and Akshay Kumar's OMG 2 since its release, Gadar 2 remains a potent draw for moviegoers, as evidenced by its impressive Rs 40 crore opening day collection. The film's strong box office performance has sustained over the weeks, with Sunday recording a commendable 72.60 percent overall occupancy rate. However, the movie is bracing itself for another challenge as Ayushmann Khurrana and Ananya Panday's Dream Girl 2 is slated for release on Friday, August 25. Gadar 2 has not only outstripped Salman Khan's Bajrangi Bhaijaan (Rs 320 crore) but has also surpassed the earnings of Tiger Zinda Hai (Rs 339 crore), PK (Rs 340 crore), and Sanju (Rs 342 crore) to claim the position of the fifth-highest grossing Hindi movie ever at the domestic box office. Emerging as the Hindi film industry's biggest post-pandemic hit after Shah Rukh Khan's Pathaan, Gadar 2 has secured its place as a blockbuster. Despite lukewarm reviews, Gadar 2 continues to set the cash registers ringing. The Indian Express critic Shubhra Gupta gave the film 1.5 stars and wrote, "Even when it came out, 22 years back, ‘Gadar’ was much too loud and melodramatic, very much the kind of doused-in-patriotism film that director Anil Sharma was known to make: that style was already going out of style. This iteration just reminds of you the loudness and the saccharine and the over-the-top dialoguing that new Bollywood had started shaking off, which we hoped was safely behind us. Clearly, in vain."

news.title: Case against 90 people for blocking Uttar Pradesh minister's convoy with stray cattle
news.text: An FIR was registered on Sunday against 90 unidentified people for blocking the convoy of Uttar Pradesh minister Dharampal Singh in Bareilly district while he was on his way to attend a programme, police said.Angry locals on August 17 blocked the animal husbandry minister's convoy by bringing stray cattle on the road in Sirauli area of his assembly constituency Aonla.Additional SP (rural) Rajkumar Agarwal said that on a complaint of veterinary officer Sanjay Kumar Sharma, an FIR under IPC Section 341 (wrongfully restraining any person) has been registered against 90 unidentified people in the matter.The minister, along with Additional Chief Secretary Rajneesh Dubey, was going for the 'bhoomi pujan' of an animal polyclinic, which is to be set up at a cost of Rs 9.14 crore at Gurgaon in Aonla tehsil where animals will get round-the-clock care. Locals from Pipariya Uprala village then blocked the road, apparently to draw his attention to the problem of stray cattle.The minister's convoy was stuck in the melee for about 40 minutes.Singh assured the villagers that a cow shelter would soon be set up after identifying the land of the gram sabha in the area.The problem of stray cattle was prominently raised by the Opposition parties during the state Assembly polls last year.Edited By: Prateek ChakrabortyPublished On: Aug 21, 2023ALSO READ | 'Cat crossing path' superstition lands 3 thieves in jail in UP's JhansiALSO READ | Watch: Superstar Rajinikanth touches Yogi Adityanath's feet post Jailer screeningMust Watch
news.author: Press Trust
